dict.string: A national enemy threatens to fire a nuclear missile at one of your military bases. What do you do?
A hurricane causes billions of dollars in damage.
You're busy winning a golf tournament
Allow victims to sleep on your property
Tweet about how sad it is
Your opponents organize a rally to protest something you did. How do you react?
Have a press conference on the issue
It is found that you have billions of dollars in assets still under your name. What do you do?
Put it in a blind trust
Famine sweeps through a developing country
Invade them while they are weak
Your population wants a new tax system
The current tax system works for the economy
A new trade agreement is proposed
Accept, but it reduces American jobs
Negotiate it heavily in your favor
You were having an affair, but it gets exposed on national TV.
Claim it has no effect on your performance
Blame it on "fake news" in the media
Illegal immigration has increased significantly in recent years. How do you solve the issue?
Build a wall to stop them
Terrorist attacks have increased lately. How do you deal with it?
Close your borders to certain countries
One of your high-ranking officials is believed to have sold national secrets to an enemy country.
Give them a less public position
A huge forest fire threatens to ignite a major city. What do you do?
Force prisoners to contain it for free
Citizens complain that the Controlled Substances Act is too strict.
Relax it, tax new legal drugs
Allow use of all homemade substances
Your administration is corrupt, and the FBI is investigating it.
Fire the head of the FBI
Bribe the FBI to stop investigating
There is an outbreak of an extremely contagious disease. What is your reaction?
Allow it to spread, it's natural
Go on vacation to avoid catching it
The scientific community wants you to do something about pollution and climate change. What do you do?
You need to make some cuts to balance your budget. What gets a budget cut?
The media asks you about your thoughts on immigration. How do you respond?
Citizens from a war-torn country wish to enter the United States as refugees. How do you handle this?
Allow some, but heavily monitor them
People are complaining about a lack of available jobs. What do you do?
Force companies to manufacture in the U.S.
Childhood obesity is on the rise. What do you do?
Require more phys ed at school
Water in certain cities has become highly contaminated, and poses a risk to citizens' health.
Find and fix the source of the issue
A large pharmaceutical company increases the price of a very important medication by 5000%. The public is outraged. What do you do?
Nothing, they own the drug, so they can
Force insurance companies to cover it
Develop and distribute a similar drug
Reduce the lifespan of drug patents
Nothing, they help fund your government
Students complain of overwhelming student debt. What do you do?
Stem cell research has the potential to help cure many diseases, but cells are harvested from fetuses. What do you do?
There is too much nuclear waste. How do you take care of it?
You release a non-violent inmate from prison, under the condition that they somehow help you. Who do you choose?
A major tech company won't give you access to their systems for surveillance.
A smaller country discovers large amounts of oil on their land.
Invade them to steal the oil
Make a trade deal with them
A video surfaces of a police officer violating a citizen's rights. What do you do?
You accidentally like an inappropriate tweet. What do you do?
A foreign country's leader is assassinated by an American. What do you do?
Say it was done to remove a dictator
Deny that you had any involvement
There has been an increase in crime accross the country. What do you do?
Say that the police are doing their best
You accidentally say something stupid on national TV. What do you do?
Continue as if you never said it
Embrace and reinforce what you said
Joke about your mistake right after
A region wants to secede from the USA. What do you do?
Allow them to have a referendum
Try to convince them to stay
